What do you all think about Chirac's comments? Already 300 Jews have been victims of anti-semitic attacks in France this year, more than all of last year. Sharon said they should come to Israel, where they won't face this hatred. Chirac said he was out of line for saying this. What does everyone think?

post_info.post_title: Chirac says Sharon not welcome in France and puts down his comments

What do you all think about Chirac's comments? Already 300 Jews have been victims of anti-semitic attacks in France this year, more than all of last year. Sharon said they should come to Israel, where they won't face this hatred. Chirac said he was out of line for saying this. What does everyone think?

 
 http://www.cnn.com/2004/WORLD/europe/07/19/france.sharon/
 Chirac says Sharon is not welcome in France
 
 http://www.lexnotes.com/misc/jacques_iraq.htm
 Chirac and Iraq (a long history-starting with DeGaulle and the French reactor that Israel destroyed.)
 
 http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/common/story_page/0,5744,10140919%255E2703,00.html
 A hoax concerning anti-semitic attack fools Chirac
 
 I think:
 Chirac has recently been earnest with his attempts to curb anti-semitism in France. For a while, he denied that it was bad. Worldwide pressure came to bear and he got off his duff and at set people to work battling it.
 
 As in the third link above, there was at least one hoax involving one purported attack.
 
 In the lexnotes link, you can see why France and Iraq were such friends. It has multiple links embedded in it that explain the relationship that really started under DeGaulle. The French built reactor in Iraq was destroyed by Israel. This likely prompted anti-semitic activity to increase in France.
 
 The cnn link shows a headline that Sharon is not welcome in France (until he explains himself). This, in itself, sounds anti-semitic to me. If anything it is a haughty attitude.
 
 The French probably don't want their Jewish population to leave because they would likely take their money with them.
Perhaps Chirac's reaction would not be such a big deal if Sharon had asked rather for the French government to fight rising anti-semetism in France.

Perhaps Chirac's reaction would not be such a big deal if Sharon had asked rather for the French government to fight rising anti-semetism in France.

 
 From what I've read, they have been fighting it...just how hard, I don't know.
